comments.body: I haven't checked this whole file (so it may already exist) but if it doesn't, make sure you add "regression" test, that tests: when no custom track height/slider thumb shape/slider tick marks are provided, the defaults are the same as they were before this change.
The tests above check for the default painting of shapes, so I think we are good there
NICE. Comments like this really help
I think you mean that the track segments before and after the thumb are longer?

They are shorter*, this was worded wrong originally. The point is that the segments are actually shorter because of the gap, where as in the enabled state it paints the entire track to the center of the thumb (underneath it). 

Please see the new comment above the enabled state expect() and the rephrased paragraph above the disabled state expect()
I think we can strengthen the tests a bit by also checking that 0 circles/rects were painted. Like-wise for the other tests too
What is the reason for all these tests to change?

The FocusableActionDetector that wraps the Slider inserts new semantics related render objects so it is more difficult to find the _RenderSlider, but the MaterialInkController can be used to test the same paint methods (This is how Switch does it)
This test still passes without the fix, can you make sure the fix is tested?

The `additionalActiveTrackHeight` is not exposed anywhere to the user, so the only way to test this without introducing new code is to extend from `RoundedRectSliderTrackShape`, override the `paint` function, and set the default value of `additionalActiveTrackHeight` to something other than 2.0. Is there a faster approach?

This is testing the test code.
You should do something like this
```dart
void paint(
    PaintingContext context,
    Offset offset, {
    required RenderBox parentBox,
    required SliderThemeData sliderTheme,
    required Animation<double> enableAnimation,
    required TextDirection textDirection,
    required Offset thumbCenter,
    bool isDiscrete = false,
    bool isEnabled = false,
}) {
    super.paint(......., additionalActiveTrackHeight: additionalActiveTrackHeight);
}
```
Ah yes, now I really feel embarrassed for copying the whole code. I'll make the changes right away :)
